title: Lärare inom datorteknik, webbutveckling och programmering
description:
Har du idéer för framtiden och drivs du av utmaningar? I Haninge får du utvecklas tillsammans med trygga kollegor som vill göra skillnad redan idag. Just nu pågår ett av de mest ambitiösa förändringsarbetena i vår kommuns historia. Vi bygger en ny stad, cirka 20 minuter från Söder. Följ med på vår resa.


**Lärare till Teknikprogrammet – Datorteknik, Webbutveckling och Programmering**

 **Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala kompetenser?**


Fredrika Bremergymnasiet söker en driven och behörig lärare inom webbutveckling, datorteknik och programmering. Hos oss får du chansen att undervisa i ett modernt Teknikprogram där innovation, kreativitet och samarbete står i centrum.


Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du får arbeta med engagerade kollegor och motiverade elever med stort engagemang för teknik och IT. Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst, tillsvidareanställning med ferieanställning.

#### 

#### **Välkommen att utvecklas med oss**


Fredrika Bremergymnasiet ligger centralt i Haninge, ca 10 minuters promenad från pendeltåget, och nära till bussar och riksväg 73.


Vår skola är en av länets största med drygt 2000 elever fördelade på 13 olika program. Vi har en unik bredd av högskoleförberedande program och yrkesprogram samt många inriktningar. Många av våra program går också att kombinera med våra idrottsakademier där elitidrottare från hela Stockholmsområdet och även övriga landet finns.


Vi erbjuder ett utvecklande arbete som engagerar och utmanar, tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor. I vår närmiljö finns, naturområde med bad, skid- och löpspår, samt Handens pendeltågsstation, endast 20 minuter från T-centralen. Vi har fri tillgång till gym i kommunhuset, friskvårdscheckar, klämdagar samt möjlighet till löne- och semesterväxling. I rollen ges du möjlighet till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling utifrån behov.


Haninge kommun tillämpar tobaksfri arbetstid.


Fredrika Bremergymnasiet eftersträvar en miljö som präglas av prestigelöshet och där viljan att leverera bästa kvalité till våra elever står i fokus. Vi söker dig som söker nya pedagogiska utmaningar och vill ta ditt nästa utvecklingssteg tillsammans med andra. Du känner ett stort engagemang för undervisning och lärande i olika former. Du är flexibel, nyfiken och öppen inför andra människors åsikter och värderingar. Du ser fram emot att arbeta tätt tillsammans i programlag och ämneslag med fokus på eleverna och skolans mål. Du är tydlig och engagerad och kan genom din goda kommunikativa och pedagogiska förmåga locka fram det bästa ur dina elever. Vi ser helst att du har flerårig pedagogisk erfarenhet och även erfarenhet av att arbeta med ämnesintegrerade projekt.

 **Varför välja oss?**


Framtidsinriktad utbildning


Vi satsar på digitalisering och teknik i framkant för att ge våra elever bästa möjliga start i en snabbt växande bransch.


Modern lärmiljö:


Tillgång till välutrustade lokaler, den senaste tekniken och digitala verktyg som stödjer undervisningen.


Starkt kollegialt samarbete:


Du blir en del av ett kompetent och engagerat arbetslag som arbetar tillsammans för att utveckla undervisningen.


Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling:


Vi uppmuntrar och erbjuder fortbildning för att du ska kunna växa i din yrkesroll.

 **Dina arbetsuppgifter**

#### **Som lärare hos oss kommer du att:**


Undervisa i kurser inom webbutveckling, datorteknik och programmering. Stödja elevernas lärande och utveckling genom ett tydligt pedagogiskt ledarskap och goda relationer. Bidra till utveckling av undervisningen i nära samarbete med programlag och ämneslag. Delta i övriga arbetsuppgifter som ingår i läraruppdraget.

 **Vi söker dig som:**


Har erfarenhet av undervisning inom datorteknik på gymnasienivå. Har djupa ämneskunskaper och en stark pedagogisk förmåga. Är strukturerad, samarbetsvillig, lyhörd och drivande. Behärskar svenska flytande i tal och skrift.

 **Personliga egenskaper**


Vi ser att du är en tydlig och engagerad ledare som inspirerar elever och skapar goda relationer med kollegor.


Du är flexibel, nyfiken och prestigelös, med ett genuint engagemang för undervisning och lärande.

 **Anställningsform**


Tillsvidareanställning


Heltid


Ferieanställning

 **Ansökan**


Vill du vara med och inspirera nästa generation av teknikutvecklare? Välkommen med din ansökan!  

Vi har redan valt annonskanaler och samarbetspartners och undanber oss vänligt men bestämt all kontakt med externa aktörer i denna rekrytering.


  
**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidareanställning


**Anställningens omfattning:** Heltid


**Tillträde:** 2/3 2026


**Antal lediga befattningar:** 1


**Sysselsättningsgrad:** 100%


**Ort:** Haninge


**Län:** Stockholms län


**Land:** Sverige


**Referensnummer:**  

2025/734


**Facklig företrädare:**  

Fackliga företrädare kontaktas via växeln
  

08-6067000


**Publicerat:** 2026-01-13

2026-02-15

title: IT Technician
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 The IT team is responsible for creating best in class employee experience by enabling productivity with technology and automation. You will be based out of the Stockholm office and have teammates in Gothenburg and Austin, Texas.
   

  

 You will
   

  

* Help users who are having issues with their laptops, phones, or office AV equipment
* Work with macOS, Windows, and Linux computers, in Google Workspace, Slack, and Jira
* Help new joiners get set up with all the tech they need to be successful
* Perform device setups using our management systems for both laptops and phones
* Write documentation, both for our use internally and for the users
* Learn new things every day as you solve new problems and work with new technologies
* Answer IT service request tickets both in person and via Slack/email, escalating as needed


**We Expect You To**
* Have a Bachelor’s degree
* Be very familiar with Windows, macOS, and/or Linux: you can run upgrades, install apps, and troubleshoot common issues on at least 2 of these OSes already
* Be proficient in Google Workspace Suite (preferred) or MS365
* Have experience with an MDM like Jamf or Intune
* Enjoy helping others and have a service mindset


 This is a full-time onsite position based in Stockholm. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
   

  

 Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

title: IT Support Engineer
description:
Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech bank dedicated to powering entrepreneurs. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue. We’ve combined technology, data, and deep market insight to create fair and accessible financing for small businesses. To continue our growth journey, we’re now looking for an IT Support Engineer who wants to take on a crucial role in building the teams that shape Qred’s future.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you’re an enabler, not just support. You’ll work alongside our platform team to eliminate friction and take our automation journey to the next level. We’ve already automated many processes within our ticketing system and MDM, and we expect you to build the solutions that push us even further. The role will include helping our employees with high-quality, hands-on IT support as well as fixing manual bottlenecks.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Drive Automation: Move us away from manual tasks by automating access management, approvals, and software provisioning.
* Own the Experience: Provide direct, in-office IT support for your fellow Qredsters, ensuring they have the tools to succeed from day one.
* Manage our Ecosystem: Take full responsibility for our all Apple environment, including MDM (Mosyle), Google Workspace, and software licensing.
* Infrastructure & Security: Maintain our office tech, from Unifi/Meraki networks and meeting room setups to client security (MDR) and compliance audits.
* Scale the Workflow: Continuously improve our internal "Way of Working" by identifying bottlenecks in how we handle hardware and software requests.


**Who You Are**
* You have 2+ years of experience in IT support, preferably with with Mac & iPhone endpoints, and a track record of building your own automations.
* You prefer getting things done over over-analyzing. You take ownership of problems until they are solved.
* You speak fluent English and thrive in an office-first environment where you interact with the team on-site every day.


 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: IT Supporter
description:
Do you want to be part of a company that connects businesses and communities across the Nordics? Are you looking for a role where your work makes a real impact? Then keep reading!
   

  

**About The Role**
*Do you want to be the person who makes technology simple, smooth, and stress-free for others? At GlobalConnect, we’re looking for an IT Supporter who shares our vision of making technology accessible and easy for every employee across our company.*
**About The Role**
 As an IT Supporter, you’ll be at the heart of our technical support operations. Some days, you’ll solve problems over the phone before the coffee even cools; other days, you’ll make sure new colleagues have everything they need to get started on their first day. You’ll help ensure our tools and systems work seamlessly so our teams can focus on what they do best.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will be diverse, ranging from setting up new equipment to assisting colleagues with their technical inquiries and maintaining system efficiency. Every interaction is an opportunity to solve a problem, learn something new, and create a positive experience for someone else.
   

  

**Some Of Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Providing first-line IT support via phone, tickets, and in person
* Manage system accesses, devices, and software for new employees
* Managing and resolving support tickets in ServiceNow
* Maintaining smooth operations in Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, and Active Directory environments


**Why join us?**
 At GlobalConnect, we believe technology should empower people, not frustrate them. Our IT team is friendly, solution-focused, and always ready to share knowledge. You’ll be part of a group that values teamwork and enjoys making everyday work life easier for colleagues across the Nordics.
   

  

 We also believe in giving you the space to learn and grow — whether that’s diving deeper into IT systems, exploring new tools, or finding smarter ways to work.
   

  

**To effectively contribute in this role, we think you’ll need:**
* An interest in IT and technology, and curiosity to keep learning
* Experience with Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, or Active Directory
* Experience with ServiceNow or other ticket management tool
* Proficiency in Swedish and fluency in English, both spoken and written


 We don’t need a personal letter unless there’s something you’d like to explain that isn’t covered in your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Data Center Technician
description:
**The Company** 




 Kolo is a Northern European data center platform built for the next era of infrastructure: AI, hybrid cloud, and critical digital services. Created in 2023 through the acquisition of two companies, and strengthened in 2025 with a third, Kolo brings together trusted operators across the Netherlands, Denmark, and Sweden under one platform.
 



 We deliver secure, high-performance colocation with a strong focus on sustainability, customer service, and technical excellence. Backed by local teams and shared values, Kolo helps ambitious organizations scale infrastructure that’s fast, flexible, and future-ready.
 



  





**Your Role** 




 We are looking for a 
 **Data Center Technician** 
  to join our team in 
 **Stockholm** 
 on a 
 **permanent and full-time contract** 
 . You will be part of the daily operations team, ensuring our facility runs smoothly, safely, and efficiently. This role combines 
 **facility management, operational tasks, and customer support** 
 . You’ll work closely with colleagues across our sites and play an important role in delivering the reliable services our customers expect.
 



 This position includes participation in an 
 **on-call rotation** 
 .
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




 In this hands-on role, your responsibilities will include:
 



**Infrastructure Operations & Support** 



* Daily monitoring of power, cooling, temperature, humidity, and alarm systems to ensure operational stability.
* Perform basic troubleshooting and diagnostics on hardware and network equipment, escalating issues as needed.
* Conduct physical installations, moves, adds, and changes of IT and network hardware.
* Handle customer infrastructure installations and coordinate Smart Hands support requests.



**Installation & Maintenance** 



* Install structured cabling (fiber and copper) and terminate connections as required.
* Rack and stack servers, storage, and networking gear; secure cabinets and containment systems.
* Assist with scheduled maintenance, documentation updates, and process improvements.



**Documentation & Safety** 



* Maintain accurate operational records, ticket updates, and inventory logs.
* Adhere to safety standards and contribute to a culture of risk awareness and compliance.



*This role includes shift rotations and occasional on-call duties to support 24/7 operations.* 




  





**The Perfect Profile Match** 




 We’re looking for someone who blends technical capability with a proactive, team-oriented mindset:
 


* Degree in Engineering or equivalent field
* Knowledge of critical operations and maintenance of properties
* IT background would be a plus
* Hands-on experience in data center operations, hardware troubleshooting, and installation activities (such as rack, cabling, structured fiber/copper work).
* Strong prioritization and organisational skills with the ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment.
* Good communication skills in Swedish & English
* Ability to work flexible hours, including shifts and on-call coverage as part of a 24/7 operational team.
* Previous experience with fiber termination, BMS/monitoring systems, or structured cabling certification would be a plus
* A proactive approach to problem solving with a focus on quality and safety.
* Service-oriented and customer-focused attitude, with clear documentation practices.



  





**The Deal** 



* A permanent & full-time employment contract, under the Technician Service Collective Bargaining Agreement (“Tekniktjänsteavtalet, Unionen and Sveriges Ingenjörer”)
* Pension, Insurance & Well-being allowance
* Opportunity to grow within a fast-growing, international data center company.
* A work culture built on collaboration, trust, and responsibility.
* A role where your work directly contributes to our customers’ success and our company’s growth.

title: Senior Cyber Security Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO​**




 The Cyber Defence Centre (CDC) is a key security function at H&M Group, forming the last line of defence verifying and supporting other security controls, safeguarding company staff and assets 24/7.  This role will strengthen our Cyber Defense Engineering capability as demand; regulatory requirements and assistance are needed throughout the organization.
   

  





 You have previously worked in the Azure cloud and with \*nix shells and have no problem navigating in VM’s or containers while doing some Python development. Now you want to grow or become the driver of good processes and system ownership, improving security posture in a global enterprise.
   

  





 Example of the work our team is doing:
   

  




* Owners of the SOC Registry, ongoing work of documenting, documenting and alerting.
* Continuously improving our ingest sources from both enterprise and e-com to filter out security events and work together with analysts visualizing current information.
* Creating patch, updates and architectural processes and routines adhering to H&M security standards and external frameworks and regulations.
* Improve way or working in the team as well as towards other teams.



  

  





**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH​**




 We are a collaborative team that works closely with analysts and other security functions within the group that we visualize data for. We have the ownership and responsibility to develop, setup, manage requirements on systems and services that we deliver to security analysts.
   

  





 It is important to this role that you are familiar with Infrastructure as Code, Terraform, Containers and a CI/CD pipeline way of working. Understand the importance of ITIL and the following processes that we visualize so that everyone can improve and enhance. We do not expect you to know everything; but you have to want to improve and move forward with the team.
   

  





  

  





**WHO YOU ARE​**




*We are looking for people with…​*



* ​Broad and deep knowledge in Python and/or Azure.
* Experience in operations, understanding importance of documentation and process flows.
* Ability to navigate in \*nix and have your favorite shell and maybe even a favorite prompt.
* An interest in security field with at least an overall knowledge of ISO standards, security frameworks and understanding of log handling and ingestion.
* Previous experience of handling large log volumes.
* Willingness to learn modern technology stacks/services.
* A proactive and collaborative mindset.



  

  





**WHO WE ARE​**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





  

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE ​**




 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. ​
   

  





 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





  

  





**JOIN US​**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





*\*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​*
  

  

  





**Please note** 
*: Interviews will start after 7 January 2026*

title: IT konsultsäljare
description:
Driva nykundsförsäljning och tillväxt hos befintliga kunder genom prospektering, kvalificering och stängning av affärer inom IT-konsulttjänster.
 



  





**Ansvar** 



* Äga hela säljcykeln: prospekt → bokning → behovsanalys → offert, förhandling, signering → överlämning till leverans.
* Bygga pipeline och driva beläggning via kalla/varma kanaler i nära samarbete med leverans / rekrytering för snabb matching och hög konsultbeläggning
* Rapportera aktivitet, konvertering och prognos i CRM



  





**Ansvarsområden och förväntade leveranser** 




 Du ska prospektera svenska små till medelstora bolag. Kanalerna som du jobbar i kan du själv påverka. Idag tänker vi events & partners, LinkedIn, kalla samtal samt inkommande leads.
 



  





 Du förväntas äga egna kundmöten senast månad 2 och egen affärspipeline från månad 3. Vidare bör du sträva efter att äga hela kedjan (äger offert → förhandling → signering → överlämning till leverans)
 



  





**Mål** 




 Vi jobbar med konkreta mål som vi utarbetar tillsammans. Exempel på mål:
 


* Kontaktade kunder
* Bokade möten
* Sålda konsulttjänster (belagd FTE)
* Nytt / förlängd / förnyad ramavtal



  





**Krav** 



* Erfarenhet: Minst 3år inom försäljning
* Meriterande:
* Brett tekniskt kunnande
* Erfarenhet av IT konsultförsäljning
* Erfarenhet av offentlig upphandling / ramavtal
* Grundläggande förståelse av moderna tech stack för trovärdig dialog.
* Språk - Svenska och engelska
* Utbildning: Inga formella krav, men bra med högskolestudier



  





  





**Beteende och arbetssätt** 



* **Driv och självständighet** 
 : sätter tydliga mål och levererar utan mikro-styrning
* **Samarbete** 
 : bygger förtroende och kan hantera intressekonflikter
* **Struktur och prioriteringar** 
 : Planerar, säger nej när det behövs, möter deadlines
* **Kommunikation** 
 : Tydlig skrift / tal, anpassar budskap till målgrupp
* **Problemlösning** 
 : Bryter ned komplexitet, testar hypoteser, lär av data
* **Kundfokus / affärsmannaskap** 
 : Översätter behov till värde och ROI.



  





**Arbetsvillkor** 



* **Plats** 
 : Stockholm (hybridpolicy - minst tre dagar på kontoret)
* **Arbetstid** 
 : Kontorstid
* **Utrustning** 
 : Dator och telefon



  





**Ersättning** 



* Lön + provision

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 High salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Front-end Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6-24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is frontend using JavaScript and TypeScript, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust frontend applications, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a teams of different sizes.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Frontend Engineer with at least 5+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* At least 5+ years of experience using JavaScript and TypeScript
* Solid skills in modern libraries and frameworks such as Next.js, React, Vue.js, Svelte, Node, NestJS, Angular, Express.js, Solid, React Native.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, temporary or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: IT-säkerhetsarkitekt
description:
Vi söker en
 **IT-säkerhetsarkitekt** 
 till ett uppdrag hos en statlig myndighet. I rollen fungerar du som ett viktigt stöd till både förvaltning och verksamhet samt deltar i projekt kopplade till IT-säkerhet, compliance och modern applikationsinfrastruktur. Du arbetar med säkerhetsarkitektur inom områden som Kubernetes, AI, integration och myndighetens säkerhetsledningssystem, med stort fokus på struktur, kravställning och dokumentation.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-säkerhet och säkerhetsarkitektur
* Dokumenterad kunskap inom IT-säkerhetsgranskningar och kravställning
* Erfarenhet av IT-compliance och arbete med regelverk och styrning
* God kännedom om minst tre regelverk såsom GDPR, OSL, DORA, NIS-2, NIST CSF eller ISO27000-serien
* Erfarenhet av tekniska miljöer som containerplattformar, Kubernetes, AI-system eller integrationslager



  





**Ansvarsområden** 



* Stödja verksamhet och förvaltning i frågor kring IT-säkerhetsarkitektur och compliance
* Arbeta med IT-säkerhet kopplat till applikationsinfrastruktur, AI och integration
* Beskriva och vidareutveckla myndighetens IT-säkerhetsarkitektur
* Följa upp säkerhetsledningssystem och efterlevnad av relevanta regelverk
* Ta fram tydlig teknisk dokumentation och rapporter riktade till både tekniker och beslutsfattare



***Annat***




*Vissa av våra kunder kräver att du genomgår och blir godkänd enligt gällande säkerhetsföreskrifter. Vissa tjänster kan också kräva specifikt medborgarskap.* 




  





**Om Astek Sweden** 




 Astek drivs av nyfikenhet och en passion för vad tekniken kan möjliggöra. Den andan genomsyrar allt vi gör vårt engagemang för innovation och produktutveckling, de långsiktiga kundpartnerskap vi bygger och det värde vi skapar i varje uppdrag, varje dag. Vi grundades 1991, är en del av den globala Astek Group och samarbetar idag med ledande industriföretag från våra kontor i Mölndal, Stockholm och Linköping med över 160 kollegor i Sverige. Vi är också certifierade som Great Place to Work® och har åtagit oss att vara 100 % klimatneutrala.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* En inspirerande arbetsplats där teknik och kreativitet möts.
* Möjligheter att samarbeta med ledande aktörer inom industrin i utmanande projekt (mekanisk design, projektledning, elektronik och mjukvara).
* Professionell utveckling och tydliga karriärvägar, med externa utbildningar anpassade efter din utvecklingsplan.
* En stöttande, rolig och inkluderande kultur där dina idéer värdesätts och teamen lyckas tillsammans.
* Generösa förmåner, inklusive ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 SEK.



 Vi uppmuntrar ingenjörer från alla bakgrunder, kön och livssituationer att söka.
 



  





**Vill du bli en del av vårt team?** 




 Vi ser varmt fram emot din ansökan! Rekrytering sker löpande, så vänta inte med att söka. Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor.

title: Frontend Infra Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 You’ll own the core web stack at Sana - from our TypeScript/React frontend to the Node services, tooling, and monorepo infrastructure that power it. This is a role for engineers who love unblocking others: you’ll design and maintain the build systems, frameworks, and developer workflows that let teams ship fast, safely, and with confidence. You’ll work on everything from core web architecture and performance to CI, testing, and local development, ensuring our web platform is modern, secure, and a joy to build on.
   

  

****In this role, you will****
* Own and evolve Sana’s TypeScript/React/Node foundations, including frameworks, services, and conventions
* Maintain and improve our monorepo tooling: build tools, dependency management, scripts, and shared services
* Design and refine local development, testing, and build workflows so they’re fast, reliable, and easy to use
* Optimize web performance, reliability, and security across our frontend and Node services
* Shape and implement our testing strategy (unit, integration, end-to-end, visual) and related tooling
* Maintain and improve CI/CD pipelines, including caching, checks, and deployment workflows
* Define and champion best practices for web development, debugging, and observability across teams
* Collaborate closely with product engineers to identify friction points and remove them through better tooling and architecture


****What success looks like****
* Developers move quickly and confidently: local dev, testing, and builds feel fast, predictable, and low-friction
* Our monorepo, build system, and dependencies are well-structured, well-documented, and easy to maintain
* Core web flows are performant, secure, and observable—from frontend interactions to Node services
* CI/CD pipelines and test infrastructure are stable, discoverable, and trusted by engineers
* Framework and dependency upgrades are routine, low-risk, and keep us at the forefront of the TypeScript/React ecosystem
* You’re seen as a go-to engineer for web architecture, performance, and developer experience - raising the bar for how we build, ship, and maintain software at Sana.


****Our tech stack****
 We build on a simple modern stack optimized for both humans and AI.
   

  

* Backend: TypeScript, Kotlin, Node.js
* Frontend: TypeScript, React, Tailwind
* Databases: Postgres, Redis
* Cloud infra: GCP/Kubernetes/Terraform


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary and compensation package
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Intresseanmälan IT-supportkonsult
description:
**Vad innebär det att vara IT-supportkonsult hos oss?**
 Som IT-supporttekniker är du navet i organisationens tekniska vardag. Du ser till att användarnas system, datorer och nätverk fungerar – och att tekniken aldrig står i vägen för arbetet. Din insats gör skillnad varje dag.
   

  

 Beroende på uppdrag kan arbetsuppgifterna variera, men här är några exempel på vad du kan få göra:
   

  

* Ge förstklassig support till användare via telefon, e-post, ärendehanteringssystem och på plats.
* Felsöka problem kopplade till operativsystem, applikationer, nätverk och kontorsutrustning.
* Installera och konfigurera datorer, skrivare, mobiltelefoner och annan IT-utrustning.
* Administrera konton och rättigheter i system som Active Directory och Microsoft 365.
* Dokumentera ärenden och lösningar – du vet hur viktig struktur är i supportvärlden.
* Samarbeta med andra tekniker och IT-specialister för att lösa mer komplexa utmaningar.
* Bidra till förbättringar, rutiner och kunskapsdelning internt..


**Vad söker vi hos en IT-supportkonsult?**
 Vi letar efter dig som har
   

  

* Yrkesutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som IT-tekniker, Onsite-tekniker eller supporttekniker, 1st eller 2nd line.
* Ett brinnande intresse för teknik och viljan att utvecklas.


 Vi ser gärna att din tekniska verktygslåda innehåller:
   

  

* Operativsystem: Windows, mac OS och/eller grundläggande Linux.
* Hårdvara & nätverk: Felsökning, konfiguration, grundläggande TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN.
* System & verktyg: Active Directory, Microsoft 365, TeamViewer, Remote Desktop.
* IT Säkerhet: Grundläggande säkerhetsprinciper – antivirus, brandväggar, säkerhetskopiering


 Men viktigast av allt – du är tålmodig, lösningsorienterad och har ett lugnt och pedagogiskt sätt när du möter användare, även när tempot är högt. Du är trygg i din tekniska kompetens men minst lika viktig är din servicekänsla och förmåga att kommunicera lösningar på ett enkelt och förståeligt sätt. Struktur och noggrannhet är en självklarhet, särskilt när det kommer till dokumentation och processer. Att hålla dig uppdaterad på nya verktyg och arbetssätt är något du gör naturligt. Du gillar att ta ansvar samt trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
   

  

 Visst låter det spännande?
   

  

 Vi vill gärna höra mer om dig och vad du brinner för inom IT-support. Skicka in din intresseanmälan idag – kanske är det just dig vi ringer när nästa spännande uppdrag kommer in.
   

  

 Vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.

title: Employer Branding & Talent Marketing Specialist
description:
H&M is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**ABOUT THE TEAM**




 The Employer Branding & Talent Marketing team strengthens how H&M shows up to current and future colleagues. We translate our brand ambition into clear, consistent employer branding and talent marketing across global and local touchpoints. Working across content, channels, and regional enablement, we partner closely with Talent Acquisition, Communications, Brand, and markets to ensure our Employer Brand is relevant, on‑brand, and activated consistently worldwide.
   

  





**ABOUT THE ROLE**




 As a Talent Marketing Specialist, you will serve as the content strategist and recruitment‑marketing writer for H&M Group’s global Employer Branding & Talent Marketing team. You will turn our brand direction, EVP development, and talent priorities into clear, compelling, fashion‑aligned content that resonates with talent audiences worldwide.
   

  





 You’ll work closely with our Social & Digital Media Specialist, Visual Content Producer, and Communications teams to ensure every touchpoint—including career site, job ads, CRM, talent pools, and social—is consistent, relevant, and designed to engage and drive conversions with key talent segments.
   

  





 This role is ideal for someone who has talent marketing experience and understands how to engage a fashion‑minded, culture‑aware audience and can turn insights into content that attracts and inspires future colleagues.
   

  





**WHAT YOU WILL DO**



1. Content Strategy & Messaging: Develop clear, on‑brand messaging for key talent groups and campaigns. Translate our Employer Brand and EVP direction into simple, scalable content frameworks used across channels and markets.
2. Recruitment Marketing Content: Write and adapt content for job ads, campaign pages, CRM journeys, talent pools, and landing pages. Create headlines, hooks, and short‑form copy tailored to fashion‑minded and culture‑aware audiences.
3. Channel‑Adapted Content (in partnership): Own the messaging and collaborate with:
4. Social & Digital Media Specialist to adapt content for Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn Life, and paid/organic formats.
5. Visual Content Producer to shape briefs, scripts, and storylines for video, photo, and evergreen assets.
6. Communications to ensure alignment with relevant editorial and corporate narratives.
7. Career Site, CRM & Candidate Experience: Shape career‑site messaging and content structure. Refresh job ads, auto‑messages, microcopy, and other recruitment touchpoints to improve clarity, consistency, and conversion.
8. Global Enablement: Develop toolkits, templates, and copy libraries that support global and regional activation. Provide scalable, on‑brand content for seasonal hiring, campaigns, and priority talent groups.



**WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE**



* Strong writing skills: clear, bold, on-brand, short‑form content tailored to key talent segments.
* Content strategy ability: able to translate brand direction and EVP themes into simple, scalable messaging for campaigns, talent groups, and global markets.
* Collaborative mindset: comfortable working with TA, Brand, Comms, Creative, People Tech, and regional teams to align messaging across touchpoints.
* Channel awareness (not ownership): Understand how content needs to adapt for social, digital, and in-store/print.
* Curiosity for colleagues and culture: interest in talent trends, inclusive storytelling, and the experiences of potential and current colleagues
* Hands‑on, structured approach: able to balance strategic thinking with practical execution in a fast‑moving global environment.



 Experience from retail or other large, people‑intensive organisations is valued, and we welcome diverse backgrounds from marketing, recruitment, or communications.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**




 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant, welcoming and values‑driven company.
   

  





**You’ll have the opportunity to:**



* Help shape how millions of people experience H&M Group as an employer
* Work with Employer Branding and Talent Marketing at true global scale
* Collaborate with experts across People, Brand, Marketing and Communications
* Build experience that opens doors across a complex, multinational organisation
* Be part of a team that believes in people, teamwork and continuous improvement.



**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**




 This is
 **a full-time permanent position** 
 based at our office in Liljeholmen and you will report to the Manager of Employer Branding & Talent Marketing. Please submit your CV in English as soon as possible.
   

  





*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*




**JOIN US**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
* Senior technical role in
 **Integration Operations team** 
 , ensuring stability, security, and performance of critical integration platforms.
* Opportunity to work with modern integration platforms and influence operational strategy and best practices.
* Be part of a fun and supportive team where you can express your creativity and skill in innovative ways.



  

  





**Key Responsibilities:**



* Act as a technical authority for:
	+ **API Management (Microsoft)**
	+ **Event Management (Solace & Kafka)**
	+ **iPaaS (Workato)**
* Ensure platform reliability and implement
 **preventative IT security** 
 :
	+ Vulnerability management, access control, secure configuration.
* Drive
 **automation and observability improvements** 
 :
	+ Automate operational tasks, enhance monitoring and alerting.
* Provide input to platform development teams.
* Follow
 **ITIL frameworks** 
 for change and incident management.
* Build strong relationships across a large organization.



  

  





**Required Technical Skills:**



* Senior-level proficiency in at least one of:
	+ Microsoft API Management, Solace/Kafka, Workato.
* Cloud experience (Azure), CI/CD familiarity.
* Scripting (Python, Bash, JavaScript, ARM, Bicep).
* Knowledge of preventative IT security.
* Experience with observability tools, such as:
	+ Splunk, Datadog, Grafana, Prometheus, Dynatrace, Azure Monitor.
* Familiarity with Open Telemetry.
* Experience with ITSM tools (ServiceNow, Jira).



  

  





**Qualifications & Experience**



* **7+ years** 
 in platform engineering or similar roles.
* Proven experience managing enterprise integration platforms.
* Expertise in monitoring, alerting, and security solutions.
* Familiarity with I
 **TIL processes.**



  

  





**Key Soft Skills**



* Strategic problem-solving
* Networking and relationship-building
* Documenting and organizing
* Curiosity and innovation



  

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

***Please note***
 : As our culture and teamwork are very important to us, four days (80%) per week of in-office presence in our office are required.
   

  





 This is a full-time position with placement in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  





  

  





**WHO WE ARE:**
  

 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  





  

  





**WHAT WE OFFER!** 
  

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.

title: Work Remote & Live in Greece (With Relocation Support)
description:
**Swedish speaker? Ready to romanticize your life a little?**
 Tired of gray skies and boring routines?
   

  

 What if your next job came with sunshine, iced coffee breaks, and new cities to explore?
   

  

 We´re hiring
 **Swedish** 
**-speaking talent** 
 to join a global team that makes the internet a safer place,
 **while you relocate to Greece with full support and work remotely** 
 . Yes, really.
   

  

 This isn´t just a job.
   

  

 It´s a reset.
   

  

 Your New Reality
   

  

 Think:
   

  

* Morning coffee on a sunny Athens balcony
* After-work walks through historic streets
* Island trips a ferry ride away
* A remote job with real purpose and global impact


 Career growth + main character energy.
   

  

 What You´ll Do
   

  

 You´ll be part of an international team focused on online safety and digital trust. Day to day, you´ll:
   

  

* Help users with empathy, clarity, and confidence
* Review and handle account and content-related requests
* Support a safer, more respectful online space
* Use insights and data to improve user experience
* Learn new skills with paid, full training provided


 No experience in this field? That´s okay — we´ve got you.
   

  

 What You Bring
   

  

* Fluent Swedish + B2 level of English
* Strong communication skills (written & verbal)
* A calm, problem-solving mindset
* Curiosity and comfort with tech tools (youll be trained)


 If you like structure but hate boring jobs — you´ll fit right in.
   

  

 Relocation to Greece — Fully Covered
   

  

 Moving from another EU country? We make it smooth:
   

  

* Flight ticket
* 2 weeks of paid hotel accommodation
* Airport pickup
* Real estate agency fees covered


 You focus on packing — we´ll handle the rest.
   

  

 Work Setup
   

  

* Relocate to Athens
* Work remotely from home
* Already living in Greece? You can work from anywhere in the country


 Remote, but not disconnected.
   

  

 The Good Stuff
   

  

* Up to €1,300 gross/month x 14 salaries
* Up to €150/month performance bonus
* Private health insurance
* Career growth in a global, mission-driven company
* Remote work flexibility
* Mediterranean lifestyle included


 Why This Job?
   

  

 Because life shouldnt be
 *only* 
 work.
   

  

 Here, you get:
   

  

* Sun, sea, and incredible food
* A diverse, international team
* A role that actually matters
* A chance to build your career and your life at the same time


 Ready to Start Fresh?
   

  

 If you´ve been craving a change, this is your sign.
   

  

 Apply now and start your
 **Work-From-Greece era**
 Your next chapter starts here.

title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux tekniker
description:
Vill du arbeta med RHEL-drift i en av Sveriges största it-miljöer? Skatteverket stärker it-leveransen till fler myndigheter och söker en Linux-tekniker som vill arbeta med it-drift i kritiska miljöer. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som Linux-tekniker blir du en del av driftteamet på Skatteverkets tekniska tjänsteenhet (STT), där vi arbetar med komplexa lösningar byggda på ledande teknologi för att säkerställa stabilitet och möta höga krav på tillgänglighet och it-säkerhet. I rollen blir du en central del i ett kompetent team med fokus på RHEL och PaaS-tjänster, där ditt arbete har direkt betydelse för en tillgänglig och säker drift.
   

  

 I den här rollen arbetar du i ett team med daglig operativ Linuxdrift. Du utför driftsättningar i produktionsmiljöer och ansvarar för underhåll och hantering av Linuxmiljöer enligt beställning. Du arbetar med incident- och larmhantering, deltar i problemutredningar och bidrar till det kontinuerliga effektiviseringsarbetet genom att föreslå förbättringar.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens och teknikutveckling. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet.
   

  

 I tjänsten ingår beredskap enligt schema samt arbete vid planerade servicefönster. Arbetet sker på plats på kontoret i Sundbyberg. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ta ansvar för dina uppgifter och kunna arbeta självständigt
* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara god lagspelare, hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant högskoleutbildning inom it alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet inom ovanstående områden som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flerårig, relevant och aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av Red Hat Enterprise Linux-drift och administration
* relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av automationsverktyg och scriptning, exempelvis Ansible


 Det är önskvärt med:
   

  

* relevant erfarenhet av drift i stora it-miljöer
* arbetslivserfarenhet av nätverk och lagringslösningar i virtuella miljöer
* erfarenhet av arbete i middlewaremiljöer, inklusive applikations- och webbservrar som Weblogic Server, Tomcat och Apache


**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 I det här jobbet finns det på grund av arbetsuppgifternas karaktär inte möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/946 | Kontakt: Maria Karlsson maria.k.karlsson@skatteverket.se, Robert Maric robert.maric@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2026-01-09 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-01-30

title: Process Developer in Lending | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about driving change and improving processes? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where your technical expertise can create real business value? If so, SEB has an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 Since our founding in 1856, SEB has been a leader in building strong customer relationships and driving sustainable growth. As one of Northern Europe’s top financial service groups, we empower our employees to grow, take responsibility, and make an impact. Welcome to SEB!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As part of the SEB Group, we at Business Services provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Our dedicated team of over 1,700 employees is focused on driving business development and growth. If you want to step up and be part of an engaging environment where you can turn your everyday actions into global results, this is where you get to shine, at the heart of the action.
   

  

 As a Process Developer, you’ll play a key role in designing, optimizing and automating end-to-end processes within the Leasing area. You’ll ensure alignment with SEB’s product and process strategies, work closely with Business Services, and leverage technical solutions, including AI, to enhance process performance, decision-making, and mitigate risks. You’ll also collaborate closely with Business, Tech, and stakeholders in the Financing Tribe to drive meaningful improvements.
   

  

**In Addition, The Role Will Also Include**
* Lead and support key change initiatives.
* Analyze, design and implement new requirements.
* Collaborate with product specialists and cross-functional teams.
* Drive process efficiency and improve workflows.
* Build and maintain end-to-end process knowledge.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* The qualities of a proactive problem solver who excels in change management and process optimization. You use data to make informed decisions and thrive in cross-functional collaboration.
* Experience in non-financial risk management.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* An analytical mindset with a solution-oriented approach.
* Familiarity with both business and technical aspects.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
* Preferable expertise in process mapping and efficiency improvements.
* Preferable proven ability to analyze data for informed decision making.
* Preferable experience in leading initiatives of varying scale.
* Preferable knowledge of technical solutions in process optimization.
* Experience or knowledge in Leasing is a plus but not required


 What we offer
   

  

* Access to extensive training and development programmes.
* A healthy work-life balance in an inclusive, welcoming culture.
* Competitive compensation and access to SEB’s staff banking benefits, including health insurance and pension savings.
* International career opportunities and exposure to a global working environment.
* A meaningful role with opportunities to drive impactful change.


 Do you want to be a part of SEB?
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than Feb 1, 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Birsena Saljunovic, birsena.saljunovic@seb.se , but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts:
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Data Scientist, Internship, Sweden - BCG X
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

**We Are BCG X**
 We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.
   

  

 You'll be part of our rapidly growing team who will have a chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.
   

  

 Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.
   

  

 We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
   

  

* Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
* Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
* Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
* Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
* Significant experience applying advanced analytics to business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
* Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
* Have strong project management skills


 What You'll Bring
   

  

**Requirements**
 Currently enrolled in a university master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field
   

  

**Technologies**
 Programming Languages: Python
   

  

 #BCGXjob
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Serviceinriktad IT-tekniker till bolag inom mode – M365 & Cloud
description:
**IT-tekniker med servicefokus och erfarenhet av M365 och Cloud**
 Vi söker en
 **serviceinriktad IT-tekniker** 
 med minst ett års erfarenhet inom IT-support. Du kommer att arbeta heltid på plats i Stockholm och via fjärrsupport, med fokus på att stötta användare och hantera enheter i en modern cloudbaserad miljö.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ge support via walk-in och remote för användare i verksamheten
* Administrera Microsoft 365-produkter: Exchange, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har minst 1 års erfarenhet av en teknikerroll inom IT-support

* Har god kunskap om Windows och Mac-miljöer

 PASSAR VI DIG?
